info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 4:43PM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains and Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 AM to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snowfall will be the heaviest Wednesday evening through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
